Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery kotyle; interior glazed (fired brown and mostly worn); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of goat grazing to right (head, antler, one foreleg and part of neck with added red remaining); blobs and incised splinter rosettes as filling ornament; below, band of staggered double dots above rays at base.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 38, pl. XVIII, no. 48)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 94, no. A129)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.236) (phase 3)
